content.description: Climb the vertical dike to the right of "Pathetic Crack", past one bolt.

Pathetic Crack is the obvious, wide crack splitting Pathetic Dome.  Don't let the guidebook fool you; it's definitely NOT a "hand crack."

The 5.6 crux is in the first ten feet of offwidth, followed by pleasant chimneying on up.

If you're planning to toprope Pathetic Face (well worth doing, since you're already here), it's just as efficient to top out left on Pathetic Crack and only build the anchor once.
content.protection: Offwidth rack; nothing small, up through a #4 Camalot.

content.description: A little "grainy" currently... Starts left or to the right... Easier to the left (Obvious)...
content.protection: four bolts, build anchors,... Easy walkoff.
content.location: across from Jumbo parking lot (cross the road) and right on the front of the Pathetic Dome. First formation on the right when hiking the trail back.

content.description:
Starts off two bolts to a nice crack and thus is a "mixed" route... Crux is down low. Crack is around 5.5 but a bit grainy still. No anchors. A large boulder can be slung or gear can be used to bring second up or TR. Easy walkoff through corridor.

It might be a wee bit harder than 10a...
content.location: The route is on the left side on the Pathetic Dome when heading away from the Jumbo parking lot.
